main event: Unidentified aerial objects were reported over Great Falls, Montana and Kansas City, Missouri in May 1951.
interesting points: The objects were described as silver or bluish white in color, appearing to be shaped like a ball or three points.
The objects were observed moving at a high rate of speed, appearing and disappearing against the blue sky.
The sightings were reported by a USAF captain, the Great Falls AFB weather detachment, the Gore Field weather station, and a Northwest Airlines pilot.
A balloon released from the Great Falls AFB was initially thought to be the object, but this was ruled out.
An unidentified object was also reported over Kansas City, Missouri on May 23, 1951.
sighted object: silver or bluish white objects, shaped like a ball or three points
location: Great Falls, Montana; Kansas City, Missouri
witnesses: USAF captain, Great Falls AFB weather detachment, Gore Field weather station, Northwest Airlines pilot
